title: Bug 19089: Missing Popup Menu in Java Editor Ruler (Photon)
description: The bug report addresses the issue of a missing popup menu in the Java editor ruler of the Photon version.
OB:
The observed behavior is that in the Photon version:
- When a Java editor is open
- Right-clicking on the left vertical ruler
This action should trigger a popup menu, enabling the user to add breakpoints, marks, and similar items. Nevertheless, it is implied that this expected behavior is not being met.
EB: The expected behavior in the Photon version is that when a Java editor is open, right-clicking on the left vertical ruler should trigger a popup menu. This popup menu should provide options to add breakpoints, marks, and other relevant functionalities. However, the bug report highlights that this expected behavior is not being met.
SR:
The steps to reproduce the issue in the Photon version, as per the bug report, are as follows:
1) Open a Java editor.
2) Right-click on the left vertical ruler. It is expected that this action should trigger a popup menu, allowing you to add breakpoints, marks, and other relevant items. However, the report suggests that the popup menu is not appearing as expected.
